LocationNotes: Elevation estimated from Google Earth from the coordinates.
Notes: Data held in PANGAEA, https://doi.org/10.1594/PANGAEA.844893. The sediment was sampled in the deepest part of the lake using a HON-Kajak sediment corer (Renberg 1991), and the short cores were subsampled in the field. In this study, we use material from the first centimetre, which was combined with the second centimetre where the material in the sediment water interface was highly unconsolidated.
Publication1: Matthias, I et al. (2015): Pollen diversity captures landscape structure and diversity. Journal of Ecology, 103(4), 880-890
Publication2: Matthias, Isabelle; Nielsen, Anne Birgitte; Giesecke, Thomas (2012): Evaluating the effect of flowering age and forest structure on pollen productivity estimates. Vegetation History and Archaeobotany, 21(6), 471-484

Notes: Data held in PANGAEA, https://doi.org/10.1594/PANGAEA.844893. The sediment was sampled in the deepest part of the lake using a HON-Kajak sediment corer (Renberg 1991), and the short cores were subsampled in the field.
